board

Class ruleController

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.ruleController

  • public class ruleController
extends java.lang.Object
    ruleController class is a class that communicate between chess and board class
    Author:
    Jami Nicastro and Ran Sa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ruleController()
      initialize a chess board that can be used for the chess class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int move(java.lang.String fr, int color)
      pass the input from the chess class to board class for moving and checking
      boolean saveKing(int color)
      see if there is any way to safe king if king is under check
      boolean simulate(java.lang.String fr, int color)
      when king is under check, see if next move (from user input) can save king from check
      java.lang.String toString()
      Print out the chess board

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ruleController

        public ruleController()
        initialize a chess board that can be used for the chess class

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public int move(java.lang.String fr,
                int color)
        pass the input from the chess class to board class for moving and checking
        Parameters:
        fr - input from the chess class
        color - who's turn is it, 0 for black, 1 for white
        Returns:
        0 if move invalid 10 resign black win 20 resign white win 30 confirm draw 40 black lose 50 white lose

      • simulate

        public boolean simulate(java.lang.String fr,
                        int color)
        when king is under check, see if next move (from user input) can save king from check
        Parameters:
        fr - user input of next move
        color - which king is in check 1 for white and 0 for black
        Returns:
        return true if the king can be saved false other wise

      • saveKing

        public boolean saveKing(int color)
        see if there is any way to safe king if king is under check
        Parameters:
        color - which king to check, 0 for black and 1 for white
        Returns:
        true if the king can be saved, false otherwise(checkmate)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Print out the chess board
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
